entries.content: When handling objections, respond always in the form of a question.
entries.notes: A core principle for navigating objections.

entries.content: Separate statements of fact from smokescreens (excuses to end the call) when handling objections.
entries.notes: Use questions to clarify the true nature of the objection.

entries.content: Challenge objections by pushing the prospect to an extreme, e.g., asking if they mean 'never ever under any circumstances'.
entries.notes: Forces clarification and often reveals the objection isn't absolute.

entries.content: Handling 'We're fine thanks': Ask, 'Didn't you mean to say everything's perfect?'
entries.notes: Challenges the statement to open conversation.

entries.content: Handling 'I'm not interested': Ask, 'Did you mean to say never ever under any circumstances would you consider exploring...?'
entries.notes: Pushes to the extreme to test the absolute nature of the objection.

entries.content: Handling 'We already have a supplier': Ask, 'Would it be fair to say there is nothing anyone could say or do... you would never ever consider exploring alternatives...?'
entries.notes: Tests if the existing supplier is an absolute, insurmountable barrier.

entries.content: Handling 'I don't take cold calls': Ask, 'What do you mean?'
entries.notes: A simple clarifying question to understand the underlying reason.

entries.content: Use clarifying questions to establish if a prospect's objection is a true statement of fact or just an easy way to dismiss you.
entries.notes: Aligns with the 'Clarify' step in objection handling frameworks.
